intro: Chandrasekharania keralensis, commonly known as Keralan chandrasekharania, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
